newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: AIRLINE COMPANIES CARRY MORE PASSENGERS.
newsitem.headline: AIRLINE COMPANIES CARRY MORE PASSENGERS.

text.p: Lithuania's statistics department said on Wednesday that the country's airlines carried 65,800 passengers in the first four months of the year, an increase of 7.8 percent compared to the same period in 1996.

The statistics department also said that Lithuanian airlines carried 693,500 tonnes of freight, luggage and post in January to April 1997, an increase of 32.1 percent compared to the same period in 1996.
It also said that in April Lithuanian airline companies carried 20,100 passengers and 202,300 tonnes of freight, luggage and post.
